title: Cadaver dogs join search for fugitive Dezi Freeman | 7NEWS
description: Cadaver dogs and specialist crews are conducting a five-day search operation in Victoria's Mount Buffalo National Park for fugitive Dezi Freeman. Police are investigating whether a gunshot heard in bushland hours after two policemen were shot indicates Freeman may have taken his own life. A $1 million reward has been offered for information leading to the capture of the alleged gunman. title: First look at Super Bowl 60 in San Francisco
description: Things are gearing up in San Francisco ahead of Super Bowl 60, with both teams touching down ahead of the big game. 7 will be covering the event live and free next Monday morning. #superbowl #nfl #patriots #sanfrancisco #seahawks

title: Punxsutawney Phil predicts winter's end on Groundhog Day
description: The world's most famous groundhog, Punxsutawney Phil, has emerged once again to predict six more weeks of Winter in the US on Groundhog Day. #groundhogday #punxsutawneyphil #groundhog #prediction #weather

title: Thousands without power in Queensland after wild storms
description: Powerful storms in South East Queensland have left thousands without power, as wind gusts up to 107km/h battered the region. #storm #wind #queensland #seq #wildweather

title: Uncontrolled bushfire raging south of Adelaide
description: More than 250 firefighters are battling an out-of-control fire on the Fleurieu Peninsula, south of Adelaide. #fire #bushfire #adelaide #fleurieupeninsula #firefighter

title: Sydney home firebombed twice in two days as police hunt arsonist | 7NEWS
description: A property in Greenacre has been firebombed twice in two days, with an unknown offender first splashing accelerant on the garage door before returning the next night to gain entry and set fire inside.   Bankstown Police Commander confirmed the unoccupied home, which was sold in December, has been the target of deliberate arson attacks, and detectives are appealing for anyone with information or CCTV footage to contact Crime Stoppers. title: Rising rate of breast cancer in younger women
description: The rate of breast cancer is increasing among younger women, now accounting for almost a quarter of all new cancer cases in women aged under 40. #cancer #breastcancer #health #womenshealth #doctor

title: Reserve Bank tipped to raise rates amid inflation concerns | 7NEWS
description: The Reserve Bank of Australia is expected to announce its decision on the official cash rate, with major economists predicting a 25 basis point increase following higher than expected inflation data. A 25 basis point rate rise would add approximately $90 per month to a $600,000 mortgage and $150 per month to a million dollar mortgage. Financial experts debate whether interest rate adjustments remain an effective tool for managing inflation in 2025, given that only 33% of Australians hold mortgages, with concerns that rate rises disproportionately impact mortgage holders whilst benefiting wealthy savers and investors. title: Desperate search for TV host's missing mother | 7NEWS
description: Nancy Guthrie, the 84-year-old mother of Melbourne-born NBC Today Show host Savannah Guthrie, has been missing since 1 February from her Arizona home. Police believe she was taken from her bed against her will and have declared her home a crime scene. Authorities say Nancy, who has physical ailments but no dementia, could not have walked from the home on her own and are treating the case as an abduction. title: World-first personalised vaccine trial for childhood brain cancer | 7NEWS
description: A world-first trial of personalised mRNA vaccines will treat children with deadly brain cancers who are not expected to survive more than two years. The treatment analyses the genetic makeup of each child's tumour to design a messenger RNA vaccine specifically targeting their individual cancer. Eight hospitals across Australia will begin rolling out the trials later this year. title: Trump threatens to sue Grammys host Trevor Noah | 7NEWS
description: US President Donald Trump has threatened to sue Grammy Awards host Trevor Noah over a joke linking him to Jeffrey Epstein's private island. Trump responded from the Oval Office, calling Noah a lousy host and denying any connection to Epstein, whilst the Grammys also featured multiple artists protesting the administration's immigration policies. Both Trump and Bill Clinton have denied wrongdoing and have never been accused by authorities in connection with Epstein. title: NSW bans hate speech as Coalition crisis deepens | 7NEWS
description: The New South Wales government has banned anti-Semitic comments across all schools in the state, with staff facing instant dismissal for engaging in hate speech. The Liberal-National Coalition remains fractured following failed reconciliation talks, with both parties pursuing separate strategies to regain voter support in their respective strongholds. Psychologists warn that giving children highly unique names may cause lifelong psychological harm, though experts note the impact may relate more to parenting styles than the names themselves. title: Clintons agree to testify over Jeffrey Epstein scandal
description: In a major development in the Jeffrey Epstein scandal, Bill and Hillary Clinton have agreed to testify before the House Oversight Committee. The couple faced being held in contempt if they refused to cooperate. #epstein #jeffreyepstein #clintons #billclinton #hillaryclinton
